intro: Ligusticopsis likiangensis, commonly known as the Yunnan angelica, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It is valued for its medicinal properties and is often used in traditional Chinese medicine. Ligusticopsis likiangensis thrives in cool, humid climates and is typically found in forested areas at high altitudes.
